entry.title: bitcoin.org missing bitcoin core version 22.0
entry.summary:
The email highlights a significant issue related to SEO, specifically concerning the official Bitcoin Core full node implementation and the challenges website owners face in maintaining domain integrity against malicious actors. It points out that there is only one legitimate website for downloading Bitcoin Core, which is accessible at [https://bitcoincore.org](https://bitcoincore.org). The sender warns of the potential risk posed by other domains using punycode to mimic the official site, a tactic employed to spread malware, as detailed on a [Bitcoin Stack Exchange post](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/a/107738/).
Furthermore, the email suggests actions that can be taken if individuals encounter issues or wish to discuss matters related to the website's management. It advises opening an issue in the website's repository located at [https://github.com/bitcoin-dot-org/bitcoin.org](https://github.com/bitcoin-dot-org/bitcoin.org) and recommends tagging Cobra, who is identified as the owner of the website and domain.
Additionally, for those looking for alternatives to Bitcoin Core, the email introduces Bitcoin Knots, a derivative of Bitcoin Core. Maintained by Luke Dashjr, Bitcoin Knots is presented as a viable option and can be accessed at [https://bitcoinknots.org/](https://bitcoinknots.org/). This information serves as a resource for users seeking assistance with SEO issues related to Bitcoin Core or exploring different versions of Bitcoin software.
